direction.raw_text: registration number E180246, calling Antarctica air traffic control.  Do you read me?  Over. There is only the HISS OF STATIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't recognize that constellation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dell, plot our location. Broussard goes into action, punching buttons, lighting up all his instruments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got it.  Oh boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the hell are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just short of Zeta II Reticuli.  We haven't even reached the outer rim yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell? Standard picks up a microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Chaz speaking.  Sorry, but we are not home.  Our present location seems to be only halfway to Irth. Remain at your posts and stand by. That is all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chaz, I've got something here on my security alert.  A high priority from the computer... STANDARD Let's hear it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Computer, you have signalled a priority three message.  What is the message?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have interrupted the course of the voyage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Why ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am programmed to do so if certain conditions arise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Computer, this is Captain Standard. What conditions are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have intercepted a transmission of unknown origin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A transmission?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A voice transmission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out here? The men exchange glances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have recorded the transmission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Play it for us, please. Over the speakers, we hear a hum, a crackle, static... THEN A STRANGE, UNEARTHLY VOICE FILLS THE ROOM, SPEAKING AN ALIEN LANGUAGE .  The bizarre voice speaks a long sentence, then falls silent. The men all stare at each other in amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Computer, what language was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unknown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unknown!  What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is none of the 678 dialects spoken by technological man. There is a pause, then EVERYBODY STARTS TALKING AT THE SAME TIME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just hold it , hold it ! (glares around the room) Computer: have you attempted to analyze the transmission?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  There are two points of salient interest.  Number one: it is highly systematized, indicating intelligent origin.  Number two: certain sounds are inconsistent with the human palate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's finally happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First contact... STANDARD Sandy, can you home in on that beam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the frequency?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Computer, what's the frequency of the transmission?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dash 99. Melkonis punches buttons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got it.  It's coming from ascension 6 minutes 32 seconds, declination -39 degrees 2 seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dell -- show me that on a screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give it to you on number four. Broussard punches buttons.  One of the viewscreens flickers, and a small dot of light becomes visible in the corner of the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it.  Let me straighten it out. He twists a knob, moving the image on the screen till the dot is in the center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you get it a little closer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I'm going to do. He hits a button.  The screen flashes and a PLANET APPEARS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Planetoid.  Diameter, 120 kilometers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's tiny!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any rotation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  Two hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gravity?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Point eight six.  We can walk on it. Standard rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin, get the others up to the lounge. INTERIOR - MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM The entire crew -- STANDARD, ROBY, BROUSSARD, MELKONIS, HUNTER, and FAUST -- are all seated around a table, with Standard at the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's an S.O.S., we're morally obligated to investigate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  Seems to me we came on this trip to make some credit, not to go off on some kind of side trip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget the credit; what we have here is a chance to be the first men to contact a nonhuman intelligence .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there is some kind of alien intelligence down on that planetoid, it'd be a serious mistake for us to blunder in unequipped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, we're equipped -- ROBY Hell, no!  We don't know what's down there on that piece of rock!  It might be dangerous!  What we should do is get on the radio to the exploration authorities... and let them deal with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except it will take 75 years to get a reply back.  Don't forget how far we are from the Colonies, Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are no commercial lanes out here.  Face it, we're out of range.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men have waited centuries to contact another form of intelligent life in the universe.  This is an opportunity which may never come again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look -- STANDARD You're overruled, Martin.  Gentlemen
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THEN A STRANGE, UNEARTHLY VOICE FILLS THE ROOM, SPEAKING AN ALIEN LANGUAGE

result.ToD: EVERYBODY STARTS TALKING AT THE SAME TIME
result.heading: EVERYBODY STARTS TALKING AT THE SAME TIME

direction.raw_text: let's go. INTERIOR - BRIDGE The men are strapping in, but this time it is with grim determination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dell, I want greater magnification. More surface detail.  I want to see what this place looks like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see what I can do. He jabs his controls.  The image on the screen ZOOMS DOWN TOWARD THE PLANET; but all detail quickly vanishes into a featureless grey haze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's out of focus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- that's atmosphere.  Cloud layer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, it's stormy for a piece of rock that size!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a second. (punches buttons) Those aren't water vapor clouds; they have no moisture content.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put ship in atmospheric mode. EXTERIOR - "SNARK" - OUTER SPACE The great dish antenna on the SNARK folds down against the main body of the ship, and other parts flatten out, until the ship has assumed an aerodynamic form. INTERIOR - BRIDGE STANDARD Dell, set a course and bring us in on that beam. EXTERIOR - SPACE The SNARK's engines cough into life, and send it drifting toward the distant dot that is the planetoid. CAMERA APPROACHES THE PLANETOID, until it looms large on screen.  It is turbulent, completely enveloped in dun-colored clouds. The SNARK drops down toward the surface. INTERIOR - BRIDGE STANDARD Activate lifter quads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Activated.  Vertical drop checked. Correcting course.  On tangential course now, orbiting. (brief pause as he studies his instruments) Crossing the terminator.  Entering night side. EXTERIOR - "SNARK" - IN ORBIT Beneath the orbiting SNARK, night's curtain rolls across the planet. Descending at an angle, the SNARK drops down into the thick atmosphere of the planetoid. INTERIOR - BRIDGE ROBY Atmospheric turbulence.  Dust storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn on navigation lights. EXTERIOR - "SNARK" Hydroplaning down through the pea-soup atmosphere, a set of brilliant lights switches on, cutting through the dust, but hardly improving visibility. INTERIOR - BRIDGE BROUSSARD Approaching point of origin.  Closing at 20 kilometers, 15 and slowing. Ten.  Five.  Gentlemen, we are directly above the source of the transmission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the terrain down there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, line of sight is impossible due to dust.  Radar gives me noise. Sonar gives me noise.  Infrared -- noise.  Let's try ultraviolet.  There. Flat.  It's totally flat.  A plain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it solid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's... basalt.  Rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then take her down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop begins... now!  Fifteen kilometers and dropping... twelve... ten... eight and slowing.  Five. Three.  Two.  One kilometer and slowing.  Lock tractor beams. There is a LOUD ELECTRICAL HUM and the ship shudders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Locked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill drive engines. The engines fall silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Engines off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nine hundred meters and dropping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  700.  Hang on gentlemen. EXTERIOR - SURFACE OF PLANET - NIGHT The night-shrouded surface is a hell of blowing dust.  The SNARK hovers above it on glowing beams of light, dropping down slowly. Landing struts unfold like insect legs. INTERIOR - BRIDGE BROUSSARD And we're... down. EXTERIOR - SURFACE OF PLANET - NIGHT The ship touches down, heavily; it rocks on huge shock absorbers. INTERIOR - BRIDGE The whole ship VIBRATES VIOLENTLY FOR AN INSTANT -- then all the panels in the room flash simultaneously and the LIGHT'S GO OUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ! The lights come back on again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Engine room, what happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a minute, hold it, I'm checking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has the hull been breached?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... (scans his gauges) No, I don't see anything.  We've still got pressure. There is a BEEP from the communicator.  Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin, this is Jay.  The intakes are clogged with dust.  We overheated and burned out a whole cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn it!  How long to fix?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long to fix?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, get started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.  Talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's take a look outside.  Turn the screens back on. Melkonis hits buttons.  The screens flicker, but remain black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't see a blessed thing. EXTERIOR - SHIP - NIGHT Only a few glittering lights distinguish the ship from the absolute darkness around it. THE WIND MOANS AND SCREAMS.  DUST BLOWS IN FRONT OF THE TINY GLIMMERING LIGHTS. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - NIGHT STANDARD Kick on the floods. EXTERIOR - SHIP - NIGHT A ring of FLOODLIGHTS on the ship come to life, pouring blinding light out into the night. They illuminate nothing but a patch of featureless grey ground and clouds of blowing dust.  The wind shrieks. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - NIGHT ROBY Not much help. Standard stares at the dark screens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we can't go anywhere in this darkness.  How long till dawn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... this rock rotates every two hours.  The sun should be coming up in about 20 minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good!  Maybe we'll be able to see something then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or something will be able to see us. They all look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXTERIOR - SHIP - NIGHT (MAIN TITLE SEQUENCE) The floodlights on the SNARK fight a losing battle against the darkness and the storm.  MAIN THEME MUSIC BEGINS, EXTREMELY OMINOUS. THE TITLE APPEARS: ALIEN RUN TITLES. Gradually, the screen begins to lighten as the SUN RISES.  The silhouette of the SNARK becomes visible, like some strange insect crouching motionless on the barren plain.  The floods shut off.  Dense clouds of impenetrable dust shriek and moan, obscuring everything and reducing the sunlight to a dull orange. END MAIN TITLES. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY CLOSE ON A SCREEN - it shows nothing but swirling clouds of orange dust. PULL BACK FROM SCREEN.  The men (Standard, Roby, Broussard, and Melkonis) are sitting and standing around the room, drinking coffee and staring at the screens, which reveal only the billowing dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There could be a whole city out there and we'd never see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not sitting on our butts in here, that's for sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just settle down.  Sandy, you get any response yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.  Nothing but that same damn transmission, every 32 seconds.  I've tried every frequency on the spectrum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we just going to sit around and wait for an invitation? Roby gives Broussard a black look, then stabs a button on his console and speaks into the mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Faust!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it coming on the engines? INTERIOR - ENGINE ROOM Faust is seated at an electronic workbench, brightly lit, speaking into a wall intercom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never saw anything as fine as this dust... these cells are all pitted on a microscopic level.  I have to polish these things smooth again, so it's going to take a while.  Okay? INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY ROBY Yeah, okay. (puts down the mike)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sandy... how far are we from the source of the transmission?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Source of transmission is to the northeast... about 300 meters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close... BROUSSARD Close enough to walk to!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin, would you run me an atmospheric?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: DUST BLOWS IN FRONT OF THE TINY GLIMMERING LIGHTS

direction.raw_text: % argon, 85% nitrogen, 5% neon... and some trace elements.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nontoxic... but unbreathable. Pressure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten to the fourth dynes per square centimeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good!  Moisture content?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zero.  Dry as a bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any microorganisms?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a one.  It's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, rock particles.  Dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we won't need pressure suits, but breathing masks are called for. Sandy -- can you rig up some kind of portable unit that we can use to follow that transmission to its source?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I volunteer for the exploration party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard you.  You want to break out the side arms? INTERIOR - MAIN ARM LOCK - DAY Standard, Broussard and Melkonis enter the lock.  They all wear gloves, boots, jackets, and pistols. Broussard touches a button and the inner door slides silently shut, sealing them into the lock. They all pull on rubber full-head oxygen masks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sending.  Do you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Receiving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Receiving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.  Now just remember: keep away from those weapons unless I say otherwise.  Martin, do you read me? INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY ROBY Read you, Chaz. INTERIOR - MAIN AIR LOCK - DAY STANDARD Open the outer door. Ponderously, the outer lock door slides open.  ORANGE SUNLIGHT streams into the lock, and clouds of dust swirl in.  We hear the MOANING OF THE WIND OUTSIDE. A mobile stairway slides out of the open hatchway, and clunks as it hits the ground. Standard walks out into the storm, followed by the others. EXTERIOR - PLANETOID - DAY The three men trot down the gangplank to the surface of the planet. Their feet sink into a thick layer of dust and loose rock. The men huddle together, looking around.  The wind screams and tugs at their clothes.  Nothing can be seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way, Sandy? Melkonis is fiddling with a portable direction-finder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lead. Melkonis walks into the blinding dust clouds, followed closely by the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Martin.  We're on our way. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY Roby is the sole occupant of the bridge.  He is huddled over his console, smoking a cigarette and watching three moving blips on a screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Chaz, I hear you.  I've got you on my board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.  I'm getting you clear too. Let's just keep the line open. EXTERIOR - PLANETOID - DAY The three men plough their way through a limbo of yellow dust and shrieking wind.  With their rubbery masks and deliberate movements, they look like deep-sea divers at the bottom of a murky ocean. Melkonis leads the column, following the compass on the direction finder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't see more than three meters in any direction out here.  We're walking blind, on instruments. They wade on, following Melkonis.  Abruptly he halts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My signal's fading. He studies the direction finder. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY Roby is listening intently to the dialogue from the helmet radios.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the dust, it's interfering... His concentration is so great that he does NOT NOTICE HUNTER COMING UP BEHIND HIM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Hold it, I've got it again.  It's over that way. Standing DIRECTLY BEHIND ROBY, Hunter speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening? Startled out of his wits, Roby GASPS and whirls around to face Hunter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell! Hunter stares at Roby, whose momentary terror dissolves into embarrassed anger. EXTERIOR - PLANETOID - DAY The three men push their way through the storm.  Melkonis stops again, studies the direction finder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's close, real close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should be almost on top of it.  I just can't quite... Suddenly, Broussard grabs Standard's arm and points.  The others stare in the direction he is pointing. REVERSE ANGLE - THEIR POINT-OF-VIEW Through the dense clouds of swirling dust we can just barely make out some kind of HUGE SHAPE. As we watch, the dust clears slightly, REVEALING A GROTESQUE SHIP RISING FROM THE SHIP LIKE SOME GIGANTIC TOADSTOOL.  It is clearly of non-human manufacture. ANGLE ON THE MEN They are struck dumb by the sight of the craft.  Finally, Standard finds his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin, uh, we've found it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Found what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It appears to be some sort of spacecraft.  We're going to approach it. They start toward the alien ship. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY STANDARD (CONT'D) (over, filtered) There are no signs of life.  No lights... no movement... Roby and Hunter are listening with hypnotic concentration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're, uh, approaching the base. EXTERIOR - BASE OF TOADSTOOL SHIP - DAY A strangely shaped DOOR yawns open at the base of the ship.  Dust and sand have blown in, filling the lower part of the entrance. With great caution, the men approach the entrance and group around it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Appears to be a door hanging open, the entrance is clogged with debris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like a derelict.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin, we're going in.  I'm going to hold the conversation to a minimum from here on. INTERIOR - ALIEN SHIP - DAY The doorway is a glowing geometric blur of light against blackness, spewing dust.  In the darkness of the chamber are huge, formless shapes. Standard, Broussard and Melkonis appear silhouetted against the doorway.  They switch on flashlight-like devices called "DATASTICKS", and step in. Carefully, peering around, they pick their way past the indistinct machinery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Air lock?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's try and find the control room. As they move their lights around, they can see that the walls, ceiling, and machinery are FULL OF HUGE, IRREGULAR HOLES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at these holes.  This place looks like Swiss cheese. Broussard shines his light up into a huge hole in the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This hole goes up several decks -- looks like somebody was firing a military disintegrator in here. They all peer up the hole into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climbing gear. Standard draws out a stubby spear gun with a graplon attached to it. He aims it up into the hole and fires. The graplon is launched up into darkness, trailing a thin wire.  There is a dull CLUNK, and the wire dangles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you'll follow me. Standard attaches the wire to a powered gear box on his chest, and presses a button.  With a mechanical whine, he is pulled up into the hole, using his feet for leverage where he can. Broussard attaches the wire to his own chest unit. INTERIOR - CONTROL ROOM OF ALIEN SHIP This chamber is totally dark as Broussard arrives at the top of the hole. Standard stands with his flashlight/camera ("datastick") tracing a beam through the hanging dust. Broussard unclips himself from the climbing wire, then raises his own light.  At that moment, Melkonis arrives at the top of the hole. THEIR LIGHTS SCAN THE ROOM.  The beams are clearly visible as columns of light in the floating dust.  They reveal heavy, odd shapes. Broussard stumbles over something.  He shines his light down on it. It is a large, glossy urn, brown in color, with peculiar markings. Broussard stands it upright.  It has a round opening in the top, and is empty. Suddenly, Melkonis lets out a grunt of shock.  Their lights have illuminated something unspeakably grotesque: A HUGE ALIEN SKELETON, SEATED IN THE CONTROL CHAIR. They approach the skeleton, their lights trained on it.  IT IS A GROTESQUE THING, BEARING NO RESEMBLANCE TO THE HUMAN FORM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy Christ... Standard shines his light on the console at which the hideous skeleton is seated.  He moves his light closer and peers at the panel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at this... They approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something has been scratched here... into the veneer.  See? Traced raggedly onto the surface of the panel, as by the point of a sharp instrument, is a small triangle: Hearing something, Broussard flashes his light across the room.  As the beam scans the walls, it briefly touches on SOMETHING THAT MOVES. Melkonis convulsively yanks out his pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep away from that gun! Standard shoulders himself in front of the others.  Then, slowly, he begins to move toward the far side of the room. They approach a console on the wall, training their lights on it. There is a machine.  On the machine, a small bar moves steadily back and forth, sliding noiselessly in its grooves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just machinery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But functioning. Melkonis looks down at his direction finder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's where the transmission is coming from. He throws a switch on the direction finder -- with a crackle and a hum, the UNEARTHLY VOICE fills their earphones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A recording.  A damned automatic recording. EXTERIOR - PLANETOID - SUNSET SINISTER ANGLE ON THE SNARK.  As we watch, the sunlight turns the color of blood, and then the sun is down, leaving murky blackness in its wake.  The ring of floodlights on the ship flares into life, feebly combatting the darkness and the storm. INTERIOR - MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM The entire crew is seated around the conference table, watching holographic pictures projected onto a screen.  These are photos taken by their "datasticks" (flashlight/cameras). Standard is commenting on the changing slides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... This is the control room... Two or three pictures click onto the screen in succession, showing the suited men standing against banks of machinery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Some details of the control room... The SKELETON appears on the screen.  The men react with mutters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... This is the skeleton... another view of the skeleton... the transmitting device... The triangle that was cut into the alien's console appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... This is a closeup of the triangle we found scrawled on the console in front of the skeleton... Standard changes the slide.  The screen goes white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And that's it. He turns off the projector and brings the lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phenomenal.  Staggering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got to go back and take a lot more pictures, holograph everything .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And bring back as much physical evidence as possible, too.  The rest of the skeleton.  Some of the machinery.  Written records, if there are any. Roby is slumped in his chair.  He has said nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I agree.  This is the single most important discovery in history.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What killed it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, that thing's been dead for years.  Maybe hundreds of years.  The whole planet's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The way I figure it, they landed here for repairs or something, then they couldn't take off again.  Maybe the dust ruined their engines.  They set up an S.O.S. beacon, but nobody came.  So they died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not they ... he ... They all turn to look in the direction of Roby's nod.  CAMERA MOVES OVER TO REVEAL THE ALIEN SKULL SITTING ON A TABLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... There was only one skeleton. There is a moment of silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay... how's it coming on the repairs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... I'm going to have to blow the engines out... STANDARD And when will you be ready to do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh -- I'm not near ready yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why the hell are you sitting around here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. The men rise and begin to disperse, but Roby remains seated, deep in thought, staring at the skull.  Melkonis lingers in the room with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And there sits man's first contact with intelligent life in the universe. EXTERIOR - SHIP - NIGHT ANGLE ON THE SHIP, its spotlights cutting into the gloom. INTERIOR - ENGINE ROOM A room throbbing with power, enormous pulsing engines capable of releasing unimaginable energies. Faust has a complicated arrangement set up at the base of one of the engines, with spotlights on it.  He is wearing goggles and thin gloves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ready up there? INTERIOR - BRIDGE - NIGHT Broussard and Melkonis are seated at their consoles, conversing with Faust while they watch their instruments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, we're ready. INTERIOR - ENGINE ROOM FAUST Okay.  I'm going to start the extraction procedure now. He pauses to wipe his brow. INTERIOR - MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM Roby is alone in the room, slumped into a chair, watching the photographic slides on the screen.  He is clicking slowly through them. He stops on an angle of the skeleton, and stares at it. The alien's misshapen skull is sitting on the table next to him.  He picks it up, holds it up to the screen for comparison, and studies it. Standard appears in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alas, poor Yorick. Roby STARTS, puts down the skull.  Standard sits at the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find anything we missed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't even know what I'm looking for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still worried?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh well... you know me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've always respected your opinion, Martin.  If something worries you, it worries me. Roby reaches over and changes the slide, to the one of the CRUDELY DRAWN TRIANGLE ON THE ALIEN CONTROL PANEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would you say that was supposed to mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... it's obviously intentional... some kind of attempt at communication... maybe it's a symbol that means something to them... ROBY But why draw it on the wall? Roby switches off the projector, sits up, and rubs his face wearily. He rises and goes to the coffee machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This ship is full of cat hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell you what, Martin.  As soon as the engine's fixed -- BEEP!  The communicator interrupts Standard.  He leans across and presses the button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Chaz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chaz, this is Dell.  Can you come topside for a minute?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the sun just came up again, and it seems the wind's died down. It's as clear as a bell outside. There's something I think you ought to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on my way. He and Roby head for the door. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY Broussard is alone in the control room when Standard and Roby arrive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a look. EXTERIOR - SHIP - DAY The dust no longer blows.  The day is crisp, clear, and silent. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY BROUSSARD I was scanning the horizon to see what I could pick up.  Look there, on that screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it, I can't -- BLIP!  Broussard enlarges the image. The screen now shows a TAPERING STONE PYRAMID on the horizon. They all stare at the image for a long moment.  The silhouette of the PYRAMID IS INSTANTLY SUGGESTIVE OF THE SCRAWLED TRIANGLE in the alien ship. Standard presses the nearest communicator and speaks into the grille.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Chaz.  All hands topside. Now. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY - A LITTLE LATER ANGLE ON A VIEWSCREEN.  It shows the PYRAMID on the horizon.  CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal all the men, sitting and standing around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't seem much doubt about it, does there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That creature sure must have considered it important... using his last strength to draw it... BROUSSARD Maybe they built it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A marker for buried instrumentation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or a mass grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe the rest of the crew is in there -- in some kind of suspended animation, waiting to be rescued.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't necessarily built by them. On the screens, a puff of DUST blows in front of the pyramid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here comes the dust again. EXTERIOR - SHIP - DAY WITH A SHRIEK, THE DUST STORM RETURNS, completely obscuring the SNARK. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY STANDARD Well, does anyone else agree with Martin that we should not explore it? Everyone looks around the room, but no one volunteers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then the sooner we get moving, the better. EXTERIOR - PLANETOID - DAY LONG SHOT OF THE STONE PYRAMID, dust blowing in front of it.  It is a crumbling, ancient edifice, made of eroded grey stones, windowless, tapering toward the top. Standard, Broussard, and Melkonis, wearing the protective suits, approach the pyramid.  As they draw near, it becomes clear that the pyramid is roughly 50 feet tall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't make out any details or features yet... but it's definitely too regular for a natural formation... INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY Roby and Hunter are present.  They are listening to Standard's VOICE ON THE RADIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... There's one thing I can say for sure though... BUZZZZZ!  Standard's voice is DROWNED OUT BY STATIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've completely lost their signal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you get them back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying. EXTERIOR - BASE OF PYRAMID - DAY The three men come to the base of the massive structure.  Dust and sand have piled thickly around the crumbling, grey stones that form the base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This looks ancient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't tell -- these weather conditions could erode anything, fast. They walk around the base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe the entrance is buried.  Could be under our feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe there is no entrance; the thing may be solid. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY ROBY Well, there ought to be some way we can get through to them -- The INTERCOM BEEPS.  Faust's voice is heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to interrupt, but I'm gonna charge up the engines for a minute, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, okay.  Go ahead. A LOUD, POWERFUL THROBBING BEGINS, drowning out all other sounds, as the engines are tested. A light on Roby's panel is FLASHING.  We can see that it is the COMPUTER ALERT. Irritably, Roby throws the switch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a temporary sequence on the monitor -- ROBY Hold it, I can't hear a damn thing! He puts an earphone to his ear and switches the computer's voice over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead! There is a PAUSE while Roby listens to the computer.  His eyes widen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean... you've translated it? Another PAUSE as he listens to the earphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well come on, come on!  What does it say? Another PAUSE.  Roby's face changes; he looks CHILLED TO THE BONE.  His mouth works. Abruptly, THE ENGINES SHUT OFF, LEAVING A RINGING SILENCE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?  What was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The computer just translated the goddamn message.  It's not an S.O.S. It was a warning. EXTERIOR - BASE OF PYRAMID - DAY BROUSSARD Maybe we can get in by the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to try?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Broussard takes out the graplon-gun, and fires the hook up toward the top of the pyramid.  It catches.  He clips himself to the wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys just wait down here till I say it's okay to come up. Broussard turns on the climbing device, and begins to walk up the side of the pyramid. OMINOUS ANGLES showing Broussard climbing the pyramid, the dust blowing, the wind shrieking. EXTERIOR - TOP OF PYRAMID - DAY The peak of the pyramid is in extreme disrepair.  Broussard arrives at the top and clings to the jagged, crumbling stones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a hole at the top. EXTERIOR - BASE OF PYRAMID - DAY STANDARD Can we come up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's too small, only room enough for one person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you see anything in the hole? EXTERIOR - TOP OF PYRAMID - DAY Broussard leans over and looks into the hole.  He sees only blackness. Freeing one arm, he unclips his datastick from his belt, switches on the "flashlight" function, and shines it down into the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see... partway down.  It just goes down like a stovepipe.  Smooth walls.  I can't see the bottom -- light won't reach. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY Faust comes trotting up the steps, a questioning look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?  What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay, we've got a problem.  I was wondering if there was any way you could shortcut the repairs and give us immediate takeoff capability.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, what's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The computer's translated the alien signal, and it's kind of alarming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It couldn't translate the whole thing, only three phrases.  I'll just read it to you the way I got it: (reads from a strip of paper)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: NOT NOTICE HUNTER COMING UP BEHIND HIM
REVEALING A GROTESQUE SHIP RISING FROM THE SHIP LIKE SOME GIGANTIC TOADSTOOL
A HUGE ALIEN SKELETON, SEATED IN THE CONTROL CHAIR
IT IS A GROTESQUE THING, BEARING NO RESEMBLANCE TO THE HUMAN FORM
CAMERA MOVES OVER TO REVEAL THE ALIEN SKULL SITTING ON A TABLE

dialogue.raw_text: (picking a hair out of the coffeepot)
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: PYRAMID IS INSTANTLY SUGGESTIVE OF THE SCRAWLED TRIANGLE
DAY WITH A SHRIEK, THE DUST STORM RETURNS,
THE ENGINES SHUT OFF, LEAVING A RINGING SILENCE

direction.raw_text: ... HOSTILE... SURVIVAL... ADVISE DO NOT LAND... " (looks up at the others) And that's all it could translate. EXTERIOR - TOP OF PYRAMID - DAY Hanging from the lip of the hole, Broussard is unclipping gear from his belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dell, you want to come down, we can figure out where to go from here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I want to go in. EXTERIOR - BASE OF PYRAMID - DAY Standard and Melkonis exchange a glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Dell, but just for a preliminary look-around.  Don't unhook yourself from your cable.  And be out in less than ten minutes. EXTERIOR - TOP OF PYRAMID - DAY BROUSSARD Right. Broussard has rigged a tripod across the mouth of the hole.  He unspools a couple feet of wire from the device, and attaches the end of it to his chest unit. He climbs over the lip and drops into the hole.  He is now hanging by the wire, with his head and shoulders out of the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I'm in the mouth of the chimney now, and I'm starting down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take care. Broussard activates the climbing unit and lowers himself down into the hole. INTERIOR - PYRAMID - DAY Bracing his feet against the rough stone wall of the vertical tunnel, Broussard switches on his datastick and points it down into the depths. The beam penetrates only thirty feet or so, then is lost in darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's noticeably warmer in here.  Warm air rising from below. He starts down, paying out the line and moving down in short hops, pushing off each time with his feet. He stops to catch his breath.  His breathing rasps loudly in his helmet. A little sunlight filters down from above.  Looking up, he can see the mouth of the hole, a glowing spot of light. Standard's voice comes over his earphones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm okay.  Haven't hit bottom yet.  Definitely a column of warm air rising; it keeps the shaft clear of dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that Dell, I lost you, do you read me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but this is hard work.  Can't talk now. He kicks off and continues down, taking longer and longer hops as he gains confidence. Pausing for a moment to regain his breath, he shines the light on his instruments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm way below ground level. EXTERIOR - BASE OF PYRAMID - DAY STANDARD What'd he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't make it out -- too much interference. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY Roby and Hunter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting nowhere.  The whole area around the pyramid is dead to transmission.  I think we should go after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, no?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they don't know about the translation!  They could be in danger right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't spare the personnel.  We've got minimum takeoff capability right now.  That's why Chaz left us on board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, you chickenshit bastard -- ROBY Just can that crap!  I'm in command here till Chaz returns!  And nobody's leaving this ship! INTERIOR - PYRAMID - DAY Broussard resumes his downward climb.  SUDDENLY, HIS FEET LOSE THEIR PURCHASE AS THE WALLS OF THE SHAFT DISAPPEAR. The tunnel has reached its end.  Below him is an unfathomable, cavernous space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tunnel's gone -- cave or something below me -- feels like the tropics in here; air is warm and humid... (consults his instruments) ... high oxygen content, no dust, it's completely breathable -- Puffing with exertion, he releases his purchase on the stone walls and begins to lower himself on power.  Now he is dangling free in darkness, spinning slowly on the wire as the chest unit unwinds. Finally, his feet hit bottom.  He grunts in surprise and almost loses his balance. INTERIOR - TOMB - DAY Broussard is standing on a dusty stone floor, with a feeble column of sunlight shining down around him from the tunnel above.  Around is solid darkness. He flashes his datastick around.  The beam reveals that he is in a stone room.  STRANGE HEIROGLYPHICS are carved into the walls.  They have a primitive, religious appearance.  Row after row of pictograms stretch from floor to ceiling, some epic history in an unknown language.  Huge religious symbols dominate one wall. Spaced at intervals are stylized stone statues, depicting grotesque monsters, half anthropoid, half octopus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's unbelievable!  It's like some kind of tomb... some primitive religion!  Hey, is anybody there?  Do you read me?  Standard! Annoyed, Broussard yanks off his breathing goggles, and leaves them hanging around his neck.  He takes a deep breath of the wet air. EXTERIOR - BASE OF PYRAMID - LATE AFTERNOON Standard and Melkonis are standing around nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we don't hear from him soon, I think we better go in after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sun will be down in a minute. INTERIOR - TOMB - LATE AFTERNOON Face bare, Broussard approaches the center of the room, which is dominated by a large, broad pedestal.  On the pedestal are ROWS OF LEATHERY URNS OR JARS, EXACTLY LIKE THE ONE BROUSSARD STUMBLED ACROSS IN THE ALIEN SHIP -- EXCEPT THESE ARE ALL SEALED. He walks around the urns, studying them.  They all have sealed lids.  He shines his light on one of them; then he lays his gloved hand on it. He lifts his mask radio to his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if you can hear me, but the place is full of large bottles or jars, just like the one we found on the other ship -- except these are all sealed.  Also they're soft to the touch. He peers more closely at the leathery object.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another funny thing -- I just put my hand on it, and now there are these raised areas appearing where my fingertips were. EXTERIOR - BASE OF PYRAMID - DAY THE SUN DROPS BELOW THE HORIZON, throwing the landscape into gloom. Standard and Melkonis switch on their lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. He attaches his chest unit to the wire and starts up. INTERIOR - TOMB - NIGHT Broussard is moving his light along the rows of heiroglyphs on the wall.  They depict stylized drawings of strange monsters. He pauses to quickly change the film clip in his datastick; then he turns back to the "urn" he was examining -- BUT NOW THERE IS A HOLE IN THE TOP OF IT. He shines his light on the floor at the base of the "urn."  There lies the "lid" -- the stopper that had filled the hole.  He picks it up and studies it.  It appears more organic than artificial; the inside surface is spongy and irregular. Then he turns the light to the now-open "urn." He bends over the mouth of the "urn" shining the light in, AND WITH SHOCKING VIOLENCE, A SMALL, OCTOPUS-LIKE THING LEAPS OUT AND ATTACHES ITSELF TO HIS FACE, WRAPPING ITS TENTACLES AROUND HIS HEAD. With a MUFFLED SCREAM, he launches himself backward, tearing at the thing with his hands. EXTERIOR - TOP OF PYRAMID - NIGHT The dust blows and howls as Standard and Melkonis arrive at the top, lights bobbing in the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's his line.  We can haul him out of there if we have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll yank him right off his feet if he's not expecting it.  The line could get tangled in something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what can we do?  He's out of radio contact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should just wait a few more minutes. Standard hesitates, clinging to the lip of the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I told him to be out in ten minutes.  It's been much longer. Let's get him out of there. Standard pulls himself up and crouches precariously on the edge of the tunnel.  He begins to fiddle with the winch mechanism from which Broussard's line dangles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The line's slack.  Christ, do you think the idiot unhooked himself? He switches on the winch motor.  With a whine, it begins to reel the line in.  After a moment, the line TIGHTENS WITH A JERK -- and the motor slows down, laboring under the added weight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There, it caught!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it still coming up, or is it hooked on something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you see anything? Standard shines his light down into the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I can't see far enough.  The line's moving, though. For a moment, the two men hang to the narrow top of the pyramid, saving their strength, while the line reels in and the wind howls. Then Standard shines his light back down in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see him!  Here he comes! The winch begins to LABOR HEAVILY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get ready to grab him! Broussard appears at the top of the pit, dangling limply from the wire.  Standard reaches for him -- then RECOILS SHARPLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God, oh God no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me -- I'm going to try to get it off. With his gloved hands, Standard grasps the tentacled mess and tries to pull it from Broussard's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't come -- it's stuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell should I know?  Come on, give me a hand, let's get him out of there! The two men grapple with Broussard's limp body, lifting him from the hole. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - NIGHT Roby and Hunter are sitting moodily, silent.  There is a long moment while nothing is said, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got 'em!  They're back on my screens!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three blips!  They're coming this way! Roby grabs a microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, can you guys hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we hear you!  We're coming back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank Christ!  We lost you!  Listen, there's been a new development -- STANDARD (over, filtered) Can't talk now; Broussard's injured. We'll need some help getting him into the ship. Roby collapses into a chair, suddenly limp with apprehension.  He's feared something like this all along, and now it has begun to happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jay, this is Cleave!  Meet me at the main air lock! Hunter dashes from the room. Roby remains where he is, seated at his console.  He is stunned, his mind racing.  CAMERA MOVES IN ON HIS FACE. INTERIOR - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE AIR LOCK - NIGHT Hunter comes racing down the steps and hurries up to the inner lock door. He presses the wall intercom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin, I'm by the inner lock door! I'll wait here for you to let them in! INTERIOR - BRIDGE - NIGHT ROBY (strangely quiet) Right. INTERIOR - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE AIR LOCK - NIGHT Faust comes running up, covered with grime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know -- Broussard got hurt somehow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurt!  How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know -- maybe we'll be real lucky and he just broke his neck. (a beat) I knew we shouldn't of come down here. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - NIGHT Roby is seated alone in the room, listening to the transmission from Standard and Melkonis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin, are you there? Roby leans forward and speaks into the microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, Chaz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're coming up now, open the outer lock door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chaz -- what happened to Broussard?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's some kind of organism, it's attached itself to him.  Let us in. Roby does not reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear me, Martin?  Open the outer door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chaz, if it's an organism, and we let it in, the ship will be infected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't leave him out here, open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chaz, listen to me -- we've broken every rule of quarantine.  If we bring an organism on board, we won't have a single layer of defense left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin, this is an order!  Open the door! Hating it, Roby leans forward and throws the switch. INTERIOR - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE AIR LOCK - NIGHT A RED LIGHT goes on, on a console on the wall.  The whine of a large servo is heard, followed by a solid metallic CLUNK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outer door's open. After a moment, they hear the motor sound again, followed by another CLUNK.  The outer door has closed again.  The red light goes off. The inner door slides open, and Standard and Melkonis stagger through, carrying the sagging body of Broussard.  A cloud of choking dust follows them out of the lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You men stay clear, there's a parasite on him. Hunter and Faust RECOIL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh -- God -- oh -- FAUST Is it alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know but don't touch it. Give us a hand here, let's get him up to the Autodoc. Hunter and Faust move in carefully to help with the limp burden. INTERIOR - INFIRMARY One of them flicks on the lights as they come shuffling into the medical room, carrying Broussard. Revealed is a rather small cubicle whose walls are lined with machinery.  The principle item of interest is a mechanized bunk bed, which rests in a cradle and slides in and out of a slot in the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me, come on, let's get him up here. They slide the man onto the bunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That thing, God almighty, didn't you try to get it off him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wouldn't come. Standard yanks off his gloves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Medical gloves. They pull thin elastic gloves from a dispenser in the wall, and pull them on. Gingerly, they approach Broussard. Standard places his hands on the octopus-thing that is slowly pulsing on Broussard's face.  He grasps the tentacles in his hands and tries to pull it free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's really on there tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, let me try. Faust takes a pair of pliers from a rack, and carefully grasps the tip of one of the tentacles.  Squeezing tightly, he leans back with all his weight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it, you're tearing his face. A trickle of blood begins to ooze down Broussard's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not coming off -- not without his whole face coming off too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's let the machine work on him. Efficiently, they strip Broussard naked, then Standard presses a couple of switches on the wall.  The machine lights up, and Broussard is sucked into the slot in the wall. He is visible inside.  The machine immediately sprays a cloud of disinfectant on him, then sterilizes him with a blinding pink light. A bank of video monitors pops on, revealing X-ray images of different parts of his body.  Sensors begin to scan, relays chatter. ROBY APPEARS IN THE DOORWAY. Standard turns and looks at him.  For a long moment, the two men regard each other, then STANDARD STEPS FORWARD AND SLAPS ROBY ACROSS THE FACE. The others are shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey now, what is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand why you did that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wouldn't open the lock; he was going to leave us out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... well, maybe he should have.  I mean, you brought the goddamn thing in here.  Maybe you deserve to get slapped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, I've got work to do. Faust exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I keep my mouth pretty much shut, but I don't like hitting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I had it coming.  Let's call it settled. After a hard stare at Roby, Standard gives him a curt nod and turns his attention to the machinery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would somebody fill me in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He went into the pyramid alone.  We lost radio contact with him.  When we pulled him out, it was on his face. It won't come off, not without injuring him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did it come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How does he breathe? They study the monitors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood's thoroughly oxygenated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but how?  His nose and mouth are blocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's look inside his head. Standard punches some buttons, and on the monitors, a kind of X-ray image in vivid colors appears, depicting Broussard's HEAD AND UPPER TORSO. The parasite is clearly visible on Broussard's face.  In X-ray, the creature is a maze of complicated biology.  But the shocking thing is that, in X-ray, we can see that Broussard's jaws are forced wide open, and THE PARASITE HAS EXTRUDED SOME KIND OF LONG TUBE, WHICH IS STUFFED INTO HIS MOUTH AND DOWN HIS THROAT, ending near his stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it -- I can't tell anything -- ROBY It's some kind of organ -- it's inserted some kind of tube or something down his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... God... Hunter bends over and RETCHES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that's how it's getting oxygen to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't make any sense.  It paralyzes him... puts him into a coma... then keeps him alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't expect to understand a life form like this.  We're out of our back yard.  Things are different here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, can't we kill it?  I mean, we can't leave the damn thing on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know what might happen if we tried to kill it.  At least right now it's keeping him alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about cutting it off?  We can't pull it loose, but we can cut off everything but the bottom layer, where it's stuck to his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right... we can't stand here and do nothing. Standard picks up his dusty breathing mask and pulls it over his head. Then he pulls back on his bulky gloves.  Finally, he presses a switch and Broussard slides back out of the booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody give me a scalpel. Melkonis takes a glittering surgical blade from a slot in the wall, and carefully passes it to Standard. Clumsily because of the gloves, Standard manipulates the knife in his hand till he has a decent grip on it.  Then he flicks a little button with his thumb.  The scalpel begins to hum. Standard advances on the parasite.  The others draw back nervously. Roby reaches over and draws yet a longer blade from the rack, and holds it inconspicuously at his side. Standard bends over the parasite.  Carefully, he touches the scalpel to the extreme end of one of the tentacles, where it curves toward the back of Broussard's head. Effortlessly, the electronic blade slides through the alien tissue. Immediately, a urine-like fluid begins to flow from the wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've made an incision... it's not reacting... but some kind of yellowish fluid is leaking out of the wound... The noxious-looking liquid drips down onto the bedding next to Broussard's head.  Instantly, it starts to hiss, and a thin stream of smoke curls up from the stain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold it, this stuff's smoking! The others REACT nervously. By now, the yellow fluid has eaten a hole through the bunk bed and has dripped down onto the floor below.  The metal floor begins to bubble and sizzle, and more smoke rises. The men start to COUGH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, that smoke's poisonous!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's eating a hole in the floor! Abruptly, the men jostle their way out of the room and huddle in the corridor outside, coughing their lungs out. Standard, who is masked, remains.  Frantically, he attempts to put a bandage on the wound, but the fluid instantly melts the bandage, and in the process, some of the stuff gets on Standard's gloves.  They begin to smoke. Frantically Standard leaps back, pulling off the smouldering gloves. Then he runs out into the corridor and yanks off his mask. INTERIOR - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE INFIRMARY STANDARD That stuff's eating right through the metal!  It's going to eat through the decks and right out through the hull! By this time Standard has started to run for the stairs. INTERIOR - CORRIDORS IN SHIP Followed by the others, Standard frantically clangs down the stairs to the level below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There!  Look! A droplet of the fluid is sizzling on the ceiling.  It oozes down and drips to the floor. It bubbles on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, what can we put under it? Standard and Hunter charge down the stairs to the level below. INTERIOR - LEVEL BELOW Standard and Hunter move cautiously down the corridor, looking up at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There.  Should be coming through about there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful, don't get under it! INTERIOR - LEVEL ABOVE Roby and Melkonis crouch by the spot on the floor where the acid sizzles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, that stinks. Roby fishes a pen out of his pocket and probes into the hole in the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seems to have stopped penetrating. Hunter comes charging up the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening up here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's fizzled out. Hunter approaches and looks.  Roby straightens up, starts to put the pen back in his pocket, then changes his mind and stands holding it by the end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never saw anything like that in my life... except molecular acid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this thing uses it for blood .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell of a defense mechanism.  You don't dare kill it. Standard comes up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's stopped?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, thank heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're just plain lucky.  That could have gone right through the hull -- taken weeks to patch it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reminded me of when I was a kid and the roof leaked -- everybody running for the pots and pans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, what about Broussard? They turn and run up the stairs. INTERIOR - INFIRMARY They all come into the room (Roby carrying the partially melted pen). Broussard is still motionless on the bunk, with the thing on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did it get on him? Standard approaches and peers at Broussard's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thank God... just missed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it still dripping?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It appears to have healed itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It makes me sick to see him like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't there some way we can get it off him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see how.  But let's do what we can for him. Standard presses a button, and Broussard slides back into the diagnostic coffin.  He presses more buttons, and the displays light up again, showing different parts of Broussard's body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we'd better get some intravenous feeding started.  God knows what that thing is leaching out of him. Standard operates some controls, and the machine begins to invade Broussard's body, sliding needles into him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look there, what's that stain on his lungs? The X-ray reveals a spreading dark blot in the vicinity of Broussard's chest.  In the center, the stain is completely opaque.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It appears to be a heavy fluid of some sort... it blocks the X-rays... ROBY That tube must be depositing it in him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could be some kind of venom, or poison... HUNTER This is horrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  what about the film?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What film?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Broussard had film in his datastick, didn't he?  We can see what happened to him. INTERIOR - MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM Again we are watching slides in the darkened room.  This time Standard, Roby, Melkonis, and Hunter are watching the sequence of photographs taken automatically by Broussard's datastick as he probed the tomb. The camera reveals the "urns."  The climax of the sequence of stills comes when THE CREATURE LEAPS OUT OF THE "URN" TOWARD THE CAMERA -- and after that the camera drops to a useless angle and proceeds to show a series of meaningless blurs.  Then the reel ends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That must have been when he got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same thing must've happened to the creatures on the other ship... except they took one of those jars on board, and opened it there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At first I thought they were jars too, or artifacts anyway.  But they're not.  They're eggs, or spore casings.  Let's go back to the heiroglyphics. CLICKETYCLICKETYCLICK -- Melkonis accelerates through the slides in a blur, stopping at the one he wants -- which shows a strip of heiroglyphs on the wall of the tomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I personally can't make any sense out of it... CLICK.  CLICK.  Melkonis is changing the slides as they talk, showing different angles on the glyphs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a crude symbolic language -- looks primitive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't tell -- that kind of stuff could represent printed circuits... STANDARD That sounds a little fanciful... MELKONIS Primitive pictorial languages are based on common objects in the environment, and this can be used as a starting point for translation... ROBY What common objects?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, hadn't somebody better check on Broussard?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do it.  The rest of you continue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll come with you. INTERIOR - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE INFIRMARY Standard and Hunter come down the passageway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, it's fantastic -- the human race has gone this long without ever encountering another advanced life form, and now we run into a veritable zoo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, those things out there aren't the same, you know -- the spaceship and the pyramid.  They're from different cultures and different races.  That ship just landed here -- crashed like we did.  The pyramid and the thing from it are indigenous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could anything be indigenous to this asteroid?  It's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it wasn't always dead. They arrive at the infirmary. INTERIOR - INFIRMARY The door slides open, and they step into the room.  Hunter activates the bed, and it slides out of the wall. THERE IS A LONG, HORRIFIED PAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gone. They rush to Broussard's prone form.  THE PARASITE IS GONE FROM HIS FACE. Broussard is still unconscious, but he is breathing.  HIS FACE IS COVERED WITH SUCKER MARKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we're in for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door was closed.  It must still be in here. They immediately grow very tense.  Hunter starts edging toward the door.  Standard grabs his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, don't open the door.  We don't want it escaping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what the hell good can we do in here?  We can't grab it -- it might jump on us -- STANDARD Maybe we can catch it. Standard picks up a stainless steel tray with a lid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As long as we're careful not to damage it... Tray in one hand, lid in the other, Standard begins moving slowly around the room.  There are very few places to hide. He bends down and peers under the bunk. As he is down on his hands and knees, WE SEE ONE TENTACLE OF THE THING, VIBRATING ON A LEDGE JUST ABOVE STANDARD. He rises, and HIS SHOULDER BRUSHES THE TENTACLE.  THE PARASITE DROPS TO THE FLOOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit! But the thing is not moving.  It lies motionless on the floor, its tentacles curled up.  Its color has faded to a dead-looking grey. Without taking his eyes off the thing, Standard reaches behind him and takes a long probe from the wall.  He prods the thing; it does not respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's dead. With great care, he uses the probe to fish the motionless parasite into the tray.  Then he quickly closes the lid. INTERIOR - LABORATORY Standard, Roby, and Melkonis have the parasite spread-eagled on a stainless steel table, with a bright light on it.  It is belly-side up. Wearing gloves, Standard probes at the thing with an instrument.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at these suckers -- no wonder we couldn't get it off him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that its mouth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More likely that organ -- the tube- like thing -- fits up in there. With a pair of needle-nosed pliers, Standard fishes in the fleshy aperture.  Carefully, he extracts the end of the tube-organ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ugh. Suddenly, it starts to FALL APART IN THE PLIERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quick -- it's decomposing -- gimme something to grab it with! It begins to SMOKE AND BUBBLE. Roby grabs a long pair of tongs from the wall and thrusts them at Standard -- who throws down the pliers, snatches the tongs and seizes the thing in the tongs. It is smouldering and dripping acid on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ!  Let's get it out of here! Carrying the thing, he heads for the door. INTERIOR - CORRIDORS IN SHIP The men run down the passageways, Standard carrying the dripping thing in the tongs.  It leaves little smoking droplets on the floor. INTERIOR - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE AIR LOCK They come running up to the airlock.  Roby stabs the button and the inner door slides open.  By the time Standard is in the lock, Roby is already on the intercom:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Chrissake, open the main lock! INTERIOR - AIR LOCK - DAY Roby stumbles in as the inner door closes; and with a heavy whine, the thick surface door rumbles open.  Orange sunlight billows in, followed by the inevitable dust. Standard HURLS THE CARCASS OUT, tongs and all. EXTERIOR - BASE OF SHIP - DAY The parasite hits the ground and begins to sink into the dust, smouldering and fuming. INTERIOR - AIR LOCK - DAY The outer door rolls shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, it's lethal even when it's dead! Melkonis gets down on his knees and studies the small burn-holes in the floor. Standard opens the inner door and steps out into the corridor.  There, he activates the wall intercom and punches out a combination. INTERIOR - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE AIR LOCK HUNTER (over intercom, filtered) Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's Broussard?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's running a fever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still unconscious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you do anything for him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The machine will bring his temperature down.  His vital functions are strong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. He switches off the intercom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need some coffee. He turns and walks away. INTERIOR - MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM The cat is strolling around as Roby and Melkonis drop into seats; Standard draws a cup of coffee from the machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These day and night cycles are totally disorienting.  I feel like we've been here for days, but it's only been how long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About four hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry to say it looks like you were right in the first place, Martin.  We never should have landed here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'm not trying to rub anybody's nose in anything.  The important thing is just to get away from here as fast as possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't lean on Faust any harder -- he's been working non-stop on the engines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we knew exactly what happened to the beings on the other ship -- MELKONIS We do know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They never made it off the planet. The parasites won. This brings a CHILLY SILENCE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did the parasites come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They seem native to the planet.  It's got an atmosphere and a dense gravity.  It's dead now, but once it must have been fertile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  It's just too small to support fauna as big as the parasites.  If there were a native ecology, it would have to be microscopic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couldn't the pyramid have been built here by space travellers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too primitive.  It's a pre- technological construction.  That slab was engineered by an Iron-Age culture at best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're from a dead civilization; they're spores from a tomb.  God knows how long they've been here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we better take another look at those heiroglyphs. Suddenly the door opens and Faust sticks his head in.  He is covered with dirt and grime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, guess what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The engines are fixed. EXTERIOR - PLANETOID - DAY The SNARK's engines cough and then with a ROAR BEGIN TO BELCH OUT STREAMS OF SUPERHEATED AIR, cutting through the tulgy dust. The ship roars and vibrates like a huge beast, capable of unlimited power. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY They are all at their posts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Switch on tractor beams. There is a hair-tingling ELECTRICAL HUM which permeates the whole ship, and it begins to float, like a cork in water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lock tractor beams. The pitch of the hum changes, and the ship levels itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Retract landing struts. EXTERIOR - SHIP - DAY The ship is hovering above the ground on beams of shimmering force. The landing struts fold up under the belly of the ship. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY STANDARD Take us up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up one kilometer, Jay. EXTERIOR - PLANETOID - DAY The SNARK begins to levitate up into the sky, on the beams of light. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY STANDARD Switch on lifter quads. A POWERFUL, DEEP THROBBING BEGINS.  THE SHIP VIBRATES. EXTERIOR - "SNARK" - DAY The hovering SNARK begins to accelerate through the choking atmosphere. INTERIOR - BRIDGE - DAY STANDARD Engage artificial gravity. Roby throws a switch, and the ship LURCHES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Engaged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's take her into an escape orbit. The men get busy with switches.
direction.name: direction
